org.imageterrier.locfile

Class QLFFilesCollection<F extends org.openimaj.feature.local.quantised.QuantisedLocalFeature<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.imageterrier.locfile.QLFFilesCollection<F>
  • Type Parameters:
    F - type of feature
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, QLFCollection<F>, org.terrier.indexing.Collection

    public class QLFFilesCollection<F extends org.openimaj.feature.local.quantised.QuantisedLocalFeature<?>>
extends Object
implements QLFCollection<F>
    A concrete implementation of a Collection of QLFDocuments stored on disk.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare

    • Constructor Detail

      • QLFFilesCollection

        public QLFFilesCollection(File directory,
                  String extension,
                  Class<F> featureClass)
        Construct the collection from the files in the given directory that have the given file extension. All the files are expected to contain features of the given feature class. The file search is recursive, and will also look in sub-directories of the specified directory.
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory to search
        extension - the file extension
        featureClass - the type of feature

      • QLFFilesCollection

        public QLFFilesCollection(Class<F> featureClass)
        Construct an empty collection with the given feature type.
        Parameters:
        featureClass - the type of feature

      • QLFFilesCollection

        public QLFFilesCollection(File directory,
                  String extension,
                  Class<F> featureClass,
                  String pathRegexFind,
                  String pathRegexRep)
        Construct the collection from the files in the given directory that have the given file extension. All the files are expected to contain features of the given feature class. The file search is recursive, and will also look in sub-directories of the specified directory. The final two parameters allow a regular-expression find and replace operation for be performed on the found filenames in order to create the document identifier for each QLFDocument. This is useful to ensure only the document name is stored in the index, rather than the absolute path.
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory to search
        extension - the file extension
        featureClass - the type of feature
        pathRegexFind - search string to apply to file paths
        pathRegexRep - replace string to apply to file paths
        See Also:
        String.replaceAll(String,String)

      • QLFFilesCollection

        public QLFFilesCollection(Class<F> featureClass,
                  String pathRegexFind,
                  String pathRegexRep)
        Construct an empty collection with the given feature type. The final two parameters allow a regular-expression find and replace operation for be performed on the found filenames in order to create the document identifier for each QLFDocument. This is useful to ensure only the document name is stored in the index, rather than the absolute path.
        Parameters:
        featureClass - the type of feature
        pathRegexFind - search string to apply to file paths
        pathRegexRep - replace string to apply to file paths
        See Also:
        String.replaceAll(String,String)

      • getMaxNumIDChars

        public int getMaxNumIDChars()
        Description copied from interface: QLFCollection
        Get the maximum number of characters required to store the IDs of all the documents in this collection. Assumes that the ID numbering is sequential from 1.
        Specified by:
